title: Internal Compiler Error: unexpected panic

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: E-needs-test
labels.description: Call for participation: writing correctness tests

body:
Rust Version: rustc 1.0.0-nightly (3ef8ff1f8 2015-02-12 00:38:24 +0000)

Description: When compiling the following code with rustc

``` rust
use std::ops::{Add};

fn f<T: Add>(a: T, b: T) -> Add::Output {
    a + b
}

fn main() {
    println!("a + b is {}", f::<f32>(100f32, 200f32));
}
```

the output is:

ERROR:rbml::reader: failed to find block with tag 7
error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic
note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.
note: we would appreciate a bug report: http://doc.rust-lang.org/complement-bugreport.html
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'explicit panic', C:\bot\slave\nightly-dist-rustc-win-64\build\src\librbml\lib.rs:266
